attributes.comment:
The immigration application fees should not be raised, and most certainly not
anywhere near as dramatically as the proposal indicates they would be. The
proposed fees are so exorbitant as to be prohibitive to many who qualify for
benefits. Charging more than $900 for an adjustment package is simply
unreasonable. Historically, the EAD and travel documents have had their own
fees and have been optional. A 16 year old who is in school would still have to
pay $900 for an application, but would not necessarily need the EAD or travel
document. Immigration documents should not be available only to the very
wealthy. These high prices could lead to families having to decide to apply one by
one instead of all together. It is my understanding that the ultimate goal of U.S.
immigration policy is family unification. These prices are in direct opposition to
that goal.
attributes.title: Comment SUbmitted By Jessica C. Nanez
